description: Create a compelling hero section with brand name 'Onze Audio Lab', tagline 'Podcast & Voice Post-Production', and primary CTA 'Send a clip / Get a free before/after sample'. The hero should immediately establish trust and professionalism.

Create a value proposition section highlighting: Clean consistent dialogue audio, Async workflow (no meetings required), 48-hour turnaround with rush available, 1 revision included, and optional free before/after sample (30-60s). Make this section visually distinctive and scannable.

Create service packages section with two main offerings: 1) Dialogue Cleanup with three tiers (Basic $79 for 10min, Standard $149 for 30min, Plus $249 for 60min), and 2) Podcast Edit Lite retainer (Starter $400/mo for 2 episodes, Regular $650/mo for 4 episodes). Include extras pricing: Rush 24h +40%, Extra revision +$25, Stems +$30, Intro/outro insert +$20, Heavy de-reverb as quote case-by-case. Present in clear, easy-to-compare pricing tables.

Create a before/after audio samples section with placeholders for 3 audio players: 1) Noise reduction sample, 2) Leveling/voice consistency sample, 3) De-essing or light de-reverb sample. Each should have clear labels and be easy to compare.

Create a 'How it works' section with 5 steps: 1) Client sends file (WAV/MP3/MP4) + chooses package, 2) Confirm scope and delivery time (usually 48h), 3) Deliver first version, 4) One included revision (small tweaks), 5) Final delivery + invoice. Make the workflow feel simple and frictionless.

Create an FAQ section addressing common questions about: scope limits, revision policy, file format requirements, what's NOT included, delivery standards (Podcast: -16 LUFS peak -1 dBTP, Web video: ~-14 LUFS peak -1 dBTP), and handling of challenging audio. Tone should set clear expectations while staying friendly.

Create a simple terms section covering: no meetings required (optional if needed), 1 revision included (small tweaks only), client must send one final file (multiple versions = new work), not responsible for miracles with heavily clipped/distorted/echoey source audio, heavy de-reverb or extreme cases quoted separately. Keep legal but approachable.

Create contact section with email as primary contact method, and mention payment options: PayPal, Wise, Stripe payment link. Include secondary CTA to reach out. Optional WhatsApp/IG can be added later.

Apply overall design aesthetic: clean, minimal, professional, trust-building without hype. The site should feel like a competent professional service, not a flashy agency. Single-page layout that flows naturally from hero through to contact.

Update branding throughout the site: change main brand name from 'Onze Audio Lab' to 'Baluna' and use 'Audio Lab' as a tagline/descriptor beneath or alongside the main name. Update this in the hero section, navbar, footer, and anywhere else the brand name appears.
